title: Lynda - SOLIDWORKS 2016 Essential Training
description:

5h 43m Beginner Nov 11, 2015   | Uploaded in Jan 5, 2016 by 2boweb

Subject: CAD 
Software: SOLIDWORKS 
Author: Gabriel Corbett 


This training course will teach you the essential tools and modeling techniques to design efficiently in SOLIDWORKSâ€”the world's leading CAD software for product design and development. We use the simple but effective "why, what, how" method of teaching, with the end goal of creating manufacturing-ready parts and assemblies.â€¨â€¨Author Gabriel Corbett first shows how to create 2D sketches and use the Extrude and Revolve tools to turn those sketches into 3D parts. Then he shows how to create more complex geometry with sweeps, lofts, and cuts. Then we jump into lessons covering modifier tools such as Fillet, Chamfer, Draft, and Shell. Then you learn how to create uniform standard holes with the Hole Wizard, and use the pattern and mirror features to reuse geometry. Next we combine parts into assemblies and create a moving assembly from parts and subassemblies. Finally, we create accurately annotated drawings, ready to hand off to a manufacturer.
Topics include:
	â€¢	Creating your first 3D part
	â€¢	Creating sketches
	â€¢	Modeling with the Extrude and Revolve features
	â€¢	Applying materials, colors, and backgrounds
	â€¢	Sketching basic shapes and polygons
	â€¢	Creating offset geometry
	â€¢	Moving, copying, and rotating elements 
	â€¢	Working with planes, axes, and the coordinate system 
	â€¢	Creating smooth and angled corners with fillets and chamfers 
	â€¢	Advanced part modeling with the Loft and Sweep features
	â€¢	Using the Hole Wizard
	â€¢	Designing with blocks 
	â€¢	Building assemblies and subassemblies 
	â€¢	Mating parts
	â€¢	Using design tables
	â€¢	Adding parts and assemblies to drawings
	â€¢	Adding dimension notations to a drawing
